title: CDI Bean injection inside Mocked Beans does not seem to work using QuarkusTest
body:
### Describe the bug

Hey all,  @geoand  in particular.

Im facing some issues with Service Bean Injection Inside Mocked Beans:

Stating:

https://quarkus.io/blog/mocking/

```
Finally, note in the example above we didnâ€™t mock InvoiceService, which meant that the real InvoiceService was being used in OrderServiceTest.
```

I would assume that using `@Inject` combined with `QuarkusMock.installMockForType()` the injected beans used inside my mock are automatically injected and ready to use. I actually thought in my old project this was working fine - however all injected beans in my mocked service are just null.

Debugging the mocked Bean I can see that in the original Bean inside the mock the injection points for the inject references are set but in the mock itself they are all null.

Also it does not matter if I use `@Inject `or `@InjectMock` the behaviour exposed seems to be identical. - which would make sense you're stating they have the same internals.

Can someone please point out to me how (if using `@QuarkusTest`) CDI properly injects non-mocked / spy-ed beans into my services, or if this is indeed a bug?


I build a minimal reproducer so i'm hopefully not wasting anyones time, feel free to send my a PR if i did something wrong or missed something crucial.

https://github.com/janknobloch/quarkus-mock-injection-issues

Cheers

Jan

### Expected behavior

CDI beans inside an injected Mock/Spy Bean should be available

### Actual behavior

CDI beans inside an injected Mock/Spy Bean are all null.

### How to Reproduce?

See my reproducer project run the tests inside.
https://github.com/janknobloch/quarkus-mock-injection-issues
